revised_title: Royal Society Anniversary Dinner 1957: Science, Education, and Society
tldr: The President of the Royal Society, Sir Cyril Hinshelwood, addresses the Anniversary Dinner in 1957, discussing the importance of science in education, the experimental method, and the role of the Royal Society in promoting scientific discovery and its applications. He emphasizes the need for a general appreciation of science and its impact on society, as well as the importance of supporting scientific research and development.
